p: In summary, NLC e/o suspension containing pull promoted an excellent healing, with a good re-epithelization and stratum corneum formation. Although in the underlying connective tissue, skin appendages were vacant, collagen fibers were organized in large bundles typical of the reticular layer of the dermis. Moreover, dermal papillae began to reform. There was only a mild inflammatory infiltrate, visible in a small portion in the center of the wound.
